text:
Imbottigliata il 24 marzo 2016, aperta il 24 febbraio 2017.
Dorata opalescente molto bella con una schiuma bianca pannosa e persistente.
Aroma abbastanza volatile di limone e coriandolo, leggero mandarino candito, uva bianca, lieve nota di acetone, nocciole fresche, leggerissimo ricordo di ravanello, leggermente pepata.
Al palato mandarino, note metalliche; finale complesso resinoso con scorza di pompelmo mista a mandarino, erbaceo, nocciola e note di cartone bagnato.
Corpo leggero, mediamente carbonata; di sicuro ha visto giorni migliori ma rimane comunque piacevole e beverina.
Beeroda.hu x Cake&Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary. // Hazy golden color. Aroma of dusty straw. Taste is peppery straw. Nice

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking a Sîneke by Brasserie de la Senne at Konstruktorska Business CenterMocno owocowe (cytrusy, jakies brzoskwinie i jablka?), nieco przyprawowe, rzeskie, polwytrawne, kwaskowate, goryczka srednia, do picia wiadramiOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Fles van de Caigny, 5.5% abv, volledige fles. Het glas is gevuld met een vrijwel heldere gouden vloeistof, waarbij het schuim als een wolkenkleed over het goudgele vocht is gedrapeerd. Appearance: five points. Aroma heeft wat kruidigs, licht bloemige hop, een beetje zoetig en weeige mout, honing. Zeven punten. Nootachtige droogheid met wat granige moutzoetheid in de smaak. De kruiden samen met de bitterheid blijven nog vrij lang hangen. Sieben punkte (of iets dergelijks). De bitterheid bevalt me wel, maar de samenhang tussen kruidigheid en bitterheid is niet helemaal in balans. Trois points voor het mondgevoel. Sineke gaat in de middenmoot door naar de finale.
hazy pale golden colour, large off-white head; aroma of yeast, lemony and grainy, as well as some floral and peach notes; taste is the same with notable bitterness; dry mouthfeel; great Belgian ale!

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pours golden, opalescent, medium white head. Aroma of belgian yeasts, floral notes, peach, melon, spices. Flavour is medium sweet, malty, with a medium bitter end. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nice!

September 2016 - Bottle share at Leightons. Thanks Matteo! As De la Senne Sîneke, 5.5%. Hazy orange, still, huge foamy creamy head, thick lacing. Aroma is laundry powder and mint. Body is light, spritzy carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is chalky and floral, dusty and dry into the finish. Quite tasty. (3.5)

330 ml bottle from Etre Gourmet, bottled 24 Mar 16.
Amber, hazy body, with a big, fluffy, a bit rocky, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of citrus, peach, some tropical fruits, bread, some dough, slight spices.
Tastes of bread, grass, flowers, citrus, orange, some pine, subtle sweet fruits, some peppery spices, some yeast.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes smooth, lingering piney, floral, a bit yeasty, a bit spicy, subtly sweet.

Very nice, interesting Belgian Pale Ale. As always from De la Senne very smooth and balanced, with the right level of fruity, bready, yeasty and some spicy notes. I especially like how the crisp pine notes emerge towards the finish. Really lovely stuff, this brewery never disappoints!

A Belgian ale in typical De La Senne style with golden and pale malts, accessible yet perfectly brewed, well done Belgian but dry fermentation and solid bitterness. Although it wouldnt be my choice for a colab, its actually a great beer, very drinkable and bitter. Very well done. (33cl bottle from Être Gourmet)

330ml bottle [Sîneke - I would have had keîneS without the generosity of Bartlebier - thanks a lot!]. Cloudy, orangey golden colour with huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Slightly dusty, yeasty spicy aroma, fruity hints of unripe peach, floral hoppy overtones. Taste is bone-dry, hoppy, slightly fruity, hints of unripe peach, some quince, woody pineapple, mild dusty yeasty overtones, a touch of white pepper; lasting, bitter finish, prickling carbonation. Literally "airy" - with ameliorative and pejorative connotation.

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Gourmet. Pours hazy, light pale yellow with a large, frothy white head. Aroma has sweet malts, doughy, citrus, light peppery. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has nice grainy wheat, light yeast, fine citrus. Firm, lingering bitterness. Very fresh and drinkable.
Bottle at Nialls. Pours golden orange, nose is caramel, orange, toffee, taste is dry, herbal, light fruit.

19th September 2016Leightons flat clearance. Thanks to Matteo. Hazy gold beer, good cream colour head. Palate is airy, semi dry and has decent carbonation. Airy malts. Light floralness. Light dry pithy citrus. Bitterish fruits. Pretty dull hut everyone else liked it.

Robe dorée, fine mousse. Nez élégant et complexe sur des notes de houblon, de fruits mûrs, de céréales, de levure sur un fond légèrement malté. Bouche à lattaque finement acidulée, de lélégance, du fruit, de la fraîcheur, une belle bulle et une finale amère. Une très belle bière tout en équilibre. Bière de soif et de plaisir

Flaska från Etre Gourmete. Bärnstensfärgad, disig, högt vitt skum. Torr modern belgo-IPA. Fruktig doft utan större sötma och svår att sätta fingret på, kanske mango gula plommon och citruszest men också gräs och omogen säd. Smaken är också torrt fruktig med relativt stor beska och lite träig eftersmak. I kroppen finns en mjuk rundhet med lätt sötma som lyfter fruktigheten en aning och balanserar den torra humlen som dock har ett rejält övertag. Ganska drickvänlig, krispig och frisk. Gott.

33cl bottle shared at Leightons garbage share. Sourced via Etre. It pours a hazed pale straw color with a large creamy white head. Aroma is tangy grassy and lemony with notes of grass, citrus peel, light funk and grain. Taste is also citric and crispy with notes of straw, grass and lemon peel. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, tasty one

Bottle shared at Leightons gaff , 19/09/2016. Many thanks to matteo. A clouded yellow straw coloured pour with a a lasting thin white head. Aroma is n, Ive fresh sweet floral citrus pollen, midget gems, sharp citrus. Flavour is composed of light grains, bready, pineapple, water Mellon, wheat, straw, pollen. Palate is frothy, straw, highish carbonation, semi drying finish. Frothy. Like it.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Matt. Pours hazy gold with a frothy, white head. The nose has notes of peach, melon, wheat, tangerine. Medium sweet flavour with light grassy bitterness, more peach and melon, pale grains, citrus rind. Light bodied with massaging carbonation. Finishes with notes of wheat bread, more rindy citrus, nectarine, peach. Nice beer.

Bottle thanks to Matteo. It pours cloudy orange with a medium, foamy carbonation white head. The aroma is fresh, bready, soft orange citrus, peachy, nectarine, candy, perfume and floral notes. The taste is crisp, bitter, juicy, fragrant, floral, peach, nectarine, persimmon and some bread with a smooath finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Well - rounded and quaffable.

Bottle split at Bespin, thanks to Matteo, 19/09/16.
Hazed orange with a decent off white cap.
Nose is tangerine, straw, lemon rind, hint of melon, light yeast tang.
Taste comprises melon, orange peel, light perfume, straw, tangy citric sherbets, light candyfloss.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Decent Belgo stylee.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at home, bought at Geers. Pretty spicy, typical De La Senne hops, and light refresher. not great, just good.
33cl bottle from beergium. Hazy light gold color. Thin persistent white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Finish is long and dry. Aroma is herby, spicy, hoppy, resin, wood, leaves.
Draught @ Akkurat. Balanced and drinkable with notes of caramel, herbs and grass. Pretty dry finish.
Draught at akkurat. Pours amber with white head. Aroma and taste has deep notes of jasmin Flowers. A really nice beer.

Bottle from Geers, Gent - BE. Color: golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam (mistake: a blond beer tagged as amber...). Smell: nice malt caramel domination with grassy and hoppy balance. Taste: medium body with caramel taste balanced with grassy hops and good bitterness. Good attenuation quiet drinkable. Aftertaste: good attenuation, wet bitterness and sweet caramel finish. Good beer, except the mistake about the appearance.

Voici donc en ce bas monde une "hoppy pale ale", pour ne pas parler dune "india pale ale" sans doute, mais il faudra que lon mexplique la différence !!
Ils se sont mis à trois, à savoir deux brasseurs : la Senne et Pleine Lune, et une caviste de Paris au 
nom bien belge : Dorothée van Agt.
Elle est présentée comme "ambrée" non filtrée, refermentée, de 5,5 % abv.
Mon exemplaire avait été brassé le 24 février 2016, mis en bouteille le 24 mars, et en validité dun an. Il était donc à 7 mois tranquilles de sa date.
En fait dambré, sa couleur est un doré foncé brillant, à la clarté nette.
Bulles très fines en plusieurs fontaines vives.
Mousse blanche bien épaisse, avec un peu de structure ferme en haut.
Arômes de malt/houblon, fleurs de haie vive, croûte de pain, camomille. Superbe nez.
1ère bouche souple et douce, à lensemble très complet malt/houblon/épices.
Arrière-bouche parfaitement à léquilibre, dense, très belle.
2ème avec un très beau malt et une grande amertume.
Arrière-bouche qui monte en puissance, magnifique.
3ème au splendide ensemble, très goûteux et harmonieux.
Arrière-bouche longue, complexe.
Longueur qui développe lamertume sur plusieurs niveaux, avec une pointe daubépine qui rappelle 
le premier nez.
Jambes serrées, groupées.
Levure jolie, assez relevée, un peu épicée, très grande ligne.
Alcool tout à fait efficace, il travaille tous les secteurs.
Finale qui est un vrai plaisir.
CONCLUSION : une très grande bière pour la semaine de la bière de Paris 2016, un vrai régal,
et ils ont bien de la chance les Titis de recevoir ce genre de cadeau ...
Mais je suis très content pour eux.
Donkergeel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak ik bitter hoppig en fruitig met iets van citrus en ananas. Mooi bier, smaak blijft redelijk lang hangen.

Bottle at Nuetnigenough. Maltier than usual, little touch of spice even. Quite biscuity, but with a lightly spicy and bitter hoppy finish. Great stuff. Little caramel and little spice. Lips tingling again. Great stuff.
Bottle at Porte Noire. Lovely hopped up wheaty ale, quite refreshing with a peppery edge. Will seek more of De La Senne collabs, they rarely disappoint.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a large off white head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Honey, minerals, citrus and candied citrus in the nose. Flavour has hay, bread, citrus, minerals, must, wood. Medium body, fine carbonation, some sweetness with balanced bitterness. Dry finish with wooden notes.
Bottle from Geers. Hazy yellow colour, lots of creamy foam; Dry bitter and grassy notes. Bitter hops. Light fruity. Easy drinkable. Nice .

Bottle. Murky orange, white head. Aroma oranges, mandarins, hops. Taste follows, emphasising the bitter hoppy elements. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl-fles van bij Dranken Geers te Oostakker. Merci Banzale! U: Helder goudblond met weelderige gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Citrus, sinaasappel, mandarijntjes, wat grassig en kruidig. S: Karamelmout met citrushop. Uitstekend in balans. Aangename tropische nabitterheid. M: Aangename, stevige carbonatie. Lekkere dorstlesser!
Bottle, from Geers. Pours yellow/golden. Stable head. Fresh hop nose, fresh crispy malt flavor. Good balanced, refreshing, good bitter finish. Sessionable.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2016 Mooi goudblond/licht oranje troebel bier met romige witte schuimkraag die snel wegvalt tot fijn laagje. Ietwat zoet aroma van mandarijn, caramel. Vol en romig in de mond met licht bittere afdronk. Smaken van gist, caramel, mout, hop, beetje honing. Niet de beste van de la Senne maar meer dan behoorlijk.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie consumed at home making burgers in the back garden Tuesday 19th July 2016, I always have high hopes with a new Brasserie De la Senne beer and this is another that hasnt let me down. Golden in colour with a little haze, soft carbonation, almost creamy mouthfeel and yet it is wonderful, so refreshing. hoppy (grassy) spice but restrained and also subtle in other ates, for example its bitter but just right not aggressive, fruity with a little lemon and orange combo. Love this beer, wish I had of picked up a few more now. A7 A4 T9 P4 Ov16 4.0
Sampled @ Van Moll Brewpub. Hazy orange color, average sized white to off-white head. Smell and taste malts, lightly hops, lightly a hint of dried fruits, apricot. Decent body and carbonation.

33cl bottle. Hazy dirty yellow with huge head. Aroma is fresh with notes of grains, sponge cake, citrus peel. lots of it. Not complex but strong alora overall. Watery with medium carbonation. Dry with juicy malts and quite strong bitterness that lasts longer then a usual beer from this brewer. A bad influence from French breweries ? Anyway a very dri,nkable and refreshing brew.

Collab between three breweries, two of which I never even heard of. Bottle from De Caigny. Agressive gusher: beer streamed out of the bottle neck upon - carefully - opening. Thick patches of papery lacing, irregular, coarse, bubbly, off-white head, clear old gold colour with orangey hue and a very fine haze of yeast suspension throughout, almost invisible. Aroma of green banana (just a hint of isoamylacetate - the way it ought to be even in a Belgian blonde ale), apple peel, unripe pear, pineapple, touch honey, straw, gooseberry, white bread crust, freshly cut grass, dry earth, dried flowers, white pepper, dried orange peel, sourdough, lightly toasted bread, unripe green melon, yellow grapefruit peel. Mildly estery onset, gooseberry and green plum sourishness mixed with light apricot and pear sweetishness, hint of unripe banana, minerally and somewhat souring carbonation, spritzy but fit for the style. Bready maltiness in the middle, bit grainy edge to it but a very faint caramelly sweetish hint as well, phenolic spiciness but subtly so, bit yeasty, leading to a dry, Euro hop bitter finish, floral, grassy and a bit herbal, earthy as well, drying the back of the mouth and quenching the thirst, while some of the yeastiness and esteriness linger on. Too bad for the heavy gushing but otherwise this is a well-made example of Belgian blonde, with a rustic and rural enough character to qualify as a saison - strange that in this time of saison hype, it is not explicitly advertized as such, many of these new saisons are nothing more than just another Belgian blonde - and can learn from this. Sennes dry and bittering yeast and hop stamp is certainly there and I still like it. Not their best from a technical point of view, but once you get past the gushing, this turns out quite alright and well-balanced.
Draft at Beermoth. Hazy golden color. Aroma of dusty straw. Taste is peppery straw. Nice
Bottle at Nuetnigenough, 29th June 16. Pours amber, aroma is yeast, some spice, coriander. Taste is dry, slight bitter, floral. Liked this

On tap at Akkurat.

A bit hazy golden with a large head. Aroma of malt, hay, light yeast and some citrus. Similar taste. Rather soft and with a medium bitter finish.

Bottle in the rented apartment in Brussels. Clear golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Malty bready aroma, citrus and grass, floral notes, hay, some yeast. Grainy floral flavor, citrus, bready, hay, biscuits, floral notes, nice bitterness. Drinkable one.

Keg at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Hazy pale amber, rich firm head. Seville Orange marmelade, elderflowers and spice up front. Mid sweet with solid body and dense, rounded mouthfeel. Bready malt, some marzipan and grain, mild citrus. Balanced but distinct bitterness.

28/V/16 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 24/III/17, bottled: 23/III/16 (2016-629) 
Clear blond to orange beer, big solid creamy off-white head, stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: spicy, coriander notes, yeasty touch, bit grassy, some banana. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of almonds, marzipan without the sweetness, pretty bitter, dry, some banana peel. Aftertaste: some citrus, very bitter, bit yeasty, grapefruit touch, grassy finish.

33cl bottle. Hazy golden colour with nice white head. Malts, caramel and bread in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is bitter with some grainy and hoppy notes. Overall, I have drank better from De la Senne.

Bottle at Hotel room in Brussels. Clear golden - white head. Bitterness. Fruity. LIght zesty. Estery notes. Peppery. Light light malty. Astringent bitterness. Light burned plastic and rubber notes. Tjaaa - not the best from De la Senne.

Bottle (33 cl) from bieresgourmet.be. Hazy golden, medium white head. Bready malt aroma, slightly earthy, some peppery notes and herbal hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium to high bitterness. Genuine De la Senne stuff.

Blonde paille, petite carbo, collet fin et persistant. 
Aromes caramel, pain, légère touche resineuse. 
Attaque vive et amertume enveloppante mais pas trop prononcée.
Hazy bronze colour with a really nice, big, and creamy head. Aroma is slightly smoky, fresh fruit, and rice. Taste is bready, malty, and fruity.
Belle mousse blanche, couleur orangé, arômes fruits, levures, goût malts, légèrement houblonnée, belle rondeur. 33 Cl Biérocratie

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2016 Dorée orangé voilée, assez équilibrée entre houblon et fruité, avec une petite rondeur maltée, finale sèche, que jai trouvé sur le coup une pointe dérangeante, un poil pâteuse ? Plutôt bien mais à retester. Bue à la pression (derrière une Gens de la Lune...) chez Bière Cultes, Paris, France, pour la Paris Beer Week, le 03/05/2016.

Towering dense yellow head over finely carbonated deeper yellow-golden beer. Creamy nose, faintly hoppy, weeds, nettles, rice flakes, fresh malt. Quite bitter, but ending mild. Again some good, fresh malts, Wholemeal bread, herbal. Medium bodied at best, light, easily drinkable. Nice, pleasing - nothing extravagant.  Txs to M & L. V!
Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours orange with a monstrous white head. Sort of cooked pale fruit with a earthy note. Med body . Fruit, Saaz, yeast, malt. Tasty. Very refreshing.
On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours hazy gold with a huge white head and a fruity aroma. There is a hearty pils flavor with a dry bitter earthy finish. Refreshing and easy to drink.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fonainas, Brussels. Hazy golden to amber with a medium white head. Aroma of fruity hops, light herbal notes, green hops and light malt. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

on tap at Moeder Lambic, Brussels.
Thick creamy white head. Hazy golden pour. Easy drinking. Nicely done.
Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels 20160505. Fruity, yeasty and hoppy with green apples and grapefruits, the finish is dry and bitter.

10/06/2016 - glass from tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels.
Hazy light yellow, nice creamy white head. Nose is fresh fruity hops, a bit yeast. Taste is fruity hops, a bit yeast, light bitter-fruity ending.

Robe blonde dorée, légèrement trouble, mousse blanche moyenne laissant une dentelle sur le verre. Nez de houblons herbeux et légèrement de malts. Attaque amère très sèche, les saveurs sont herbeuses, quelques notes de levures. Très bonne longueur, bonne carbo. Bière avec une amertume sèche incroyable, vraiment très bonne, pour les amateurs de bitter !
Tap @ moeder lambic brussels. Pours a clear golden colour beer with a medium head. Crispy with some hops, herbs and pleasant bitterness. Dry finish

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Light hazy golden with thin white head. Dank cellar nose. Grassy, marijuana-like hops up front, doughiness, faint sour grains, hay, grapes, light onion, cheesy funk. Medium bitter, dry. Soft chalky texture, nice soft carbonation. Vegetal dry bitter finish, light marijuana lingering through, works well for me. Thin bit watery body. Very nice and sessionable. We want more.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Slight hazy golden with big fluffy white head. Light lime and fresh grassy hops, light sweet bready malts, a bit mineral like yeast, dried apple and peach, bitter marmalade. Light sweet and biter. Medium bodied with velvety feel. Nice stuff.
Tap at moeder fontainas. Pours unclear blonde. Small white head. Smell is malty, bit sweet, bitter , aromatic. Taste is bitter , Sharp, intense, malty, aromatic , mild sweetness.. Very Nice !
Tap at Moeder lambic Fontainas. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Hops, notes of yeast, fruity, grass, notes of pomelo. Bitter aftertaste.

Draft glass @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy orange with a big creamy white head. Nose is green grass hop & big yeast. Classical De La Senne profile but more yeast than usual. Taste is big yeast, green grass hop, very floral, finish, dry peach, milky yeast, faintly sweet almost, a bit muted. Yeasty body. Feels like the classical De La Senne profile but with more yeast than usual, dry attenuated nature is one of the things that I love De La Senne beers, this one confuses me a bit, less vibrant than usual as far as these guys go. Odd, feels kind of like an unnecessary beer, good still but they have made much better, not really getting what they were going for here.

Bottle
APPEARANCE : clear blond beer. Small stable white head. 
NOSE : fruity Hoppy pine bitter
TASTE : fruity, Hoppy, dry, bitter

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Cloudy orange with a lasting white head. Fruity aroma with herbal and malty notes. Sweetish fruity and malty flavour with good herbal hops and a medium bitter finish.

Tap @ moeder lambic. Pours hazy deep orange with a white head. Aroma of hops, strawberry, malty, quite fruity, very light. Light Belgian yeast, quite hoppy. Taste is light sweet, fresh hops, light peach notes. Moderate bitter finish.

Draft @ ML Fontainas.
Orangée présentant un léger trouble, col épais crémeux beige.
Arôme est finement houblonné procurant de belles effluves citronnées et augurant un houblonné noble, rétro levure assez typique de DLS, fin biscuité, citronné et fruité vert frais.
Palais est finement amer centré sur les houblons, fin herbacé, citronné et léger fleuri, houblon US?, Triskel? noble allemand voire anglais. Fini sec sur une signature DLS surtout niveau levure. Malt plus dominant sur des notes cara pâle ambre. Reste assez basique pour une collab, surtout après la grosse claque de la Double Saison avec Mt Salève. Au final, jattendais un peu plus niveau houblons.
